And that is part of the record including there was an ethics letter and other materials submitted in connection with your objection to that. MS. STERNHEIM: Thank you very much. THE COURT: Thank you. All right. Counsel, would you just please confirm that you've received each other's submissions? MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor. MS. STERNHEIM: Yes. THE COURT: Let's also confirm all submissions are filed on ECF. MS. MOE: That's correct, your Honor. MS. STERNHEIM: Yes. THE COURT: Thank you. Ms. Moe, I did have the government indicate this in a letter, but if you would confirm and articulate what the government has done to notify any crime victims of their rights under the Justice For All Act? MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor. With respect to the six individuals who were proved at trial to be directly impacted by the offense conduct, the government has notified those individuals through their counsel about the sentencing and about their right to be heard.
